page.title: 20SLIDES
page.content: Owing to the limestone scarp dissecting the area it's impossible to provide a complete survey in 1 slide. {SLIDE A:}Taken from N.W. corner facing S.E.shows steep,forested scarp & large arable fields on lower slopes & permanent pasture,here used for sheep instead of more common dairying. Stream in centre crosses lane at hamlet of Wigwig. {SLIDE B:}Taken top of scarp & looks down on S. of area,town Much Wenlock. Boundary of square immediately front of church. Foreground small,exclusive housing dating from early 1970's. {SLIDE C:}Indicative problems in extending cereals to top of dip slope: tractor overturned on steep slope. {SLIDE D:}Looks centrally N.from top scarp. Foreground-Homer-expanded in 1960's. Survey done 1st & 2nd year pupils & staff William Brookes school.
